ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk11:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk11:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were laughing loudly while walking in inhabited areas. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk11:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not laugh loudly while walking in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk11:1.4_0: he should not laugh loudly while walking in inhabited areas;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk11:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, laughs loudly while walking in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk11:1.6.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk11:1.8_0: To give rise to the robe.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk11:1.11_0: if he merely smiles when something is funny;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk11:1.14_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk11:1.15_0: The first training rule is finished.
